Detailed Description

The ChaosCore testing module.

Author
David Saxon

Macro Definition Documentation

#define CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL (   a,
  b 
)

Checks whether the given values are considered equal.

If a and b are equal this check will pass, else this will cause test failure.

#define CHAOS_TEST_MODULE (   path)

Declares the Test Module Path for the current file.

Files containing ChaosCore Unit Test must use this macro once and only once before any Unit Test decelerations. Unit Test paths are defined by their name and the module path in their respective file.

For example, file_1.cpp has two tests named test_a and test_b and the following module declaration:

1 CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( example.file_1 )

And file_2.cpp has one test named test_c and the following module declaration:

1 CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( example.file_2 )

The path:

1 example.file_1.test_a

defines the Unit Test in file_1.cpp called test_a.

The path:

1 example.file_1

defines the Units Tests test_a and test_b.

The path:

1 example

defines all three Unit Tests: test_a, test_b, and test_b since they all share the same parent module: example.

#define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT (   name)

Defines a ChaosCore Unit Test with no chaos::test::Fixture.

See CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE for more information.

#define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE (   name,
  fixture_type 
)

Defines a ChaosCore Unit Test with a chaos::test::Fixture.

Use this macro like a function definition to declare a Unit Test. Example:

1 CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( example_test, MyFixtureType )
2 {
3  fixture->do_something();
4 
5  CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL( 1, 2 );
6  // more testing code here
7  // ...
8 }
Parameters
nameThe name of this this Unit Test. The full name (module path + unit test name) for this test must be unique.
fixture_typeThe class name of the chaos::test::Fixture to use for this Unit test. ChaosCore will handle instantiating this object, and the fixture's startup and teardown functions will be called before and after running this test respectively. The instance of the fixture can be accessed from within this test using the keyword:
1 fixture
which provides a pointer to the fixture instance.
